result.execSummary:
The defendant Duany Acosta Mesa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bail applied for fine.  Remainder of fine to be paid within 90 days or penalty of 10 days Huber for non-payment.
Bail applied to DNA Surcharge.  Paid in full.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Duany Acosta Mesa

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Duany Acosta Mesa in court with attorney J Anthony Rosario.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Spanish Interpreter James Larson appeared, sworn in.  Court passes this case so the defendant can pay restitutuion. Case recalled at 11:06 am.  Defendant paid the restitutution.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Rosario makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following to count #1:
FINE: $1548.00 bail to be applied. 
DNA Surcharge: 250.00
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.  
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid within 90 days .  Failure to pay;  the Court orders the defendant to serve 10 days in Huber

Defendant Duany Acosta Mesa in court with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Spanish interpreter Elizabeth Barrera appeared, sworn in.  Attorney Rosario to let the court know 2 weeks before trial if this case will goto trial to secure interpreters.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for June 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for June 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Check Case scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 08:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Duany Acosta Mesa in court with attorney J Anthony Rosario.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Elizabeth Barrera, interpreter for the defendant.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Interpreter available for next scheduled hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Duany Acosta Mesa in court with attorney Adam Schleis for attorney J Anthony Rosario.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  An interpreter is needed for the next hearing.  Attorney Schleis indicates Attorney Fragoso spoke to the defendant on the phone and the defendant understands what is happening today.   Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 10:00 am.
CASH BOND WAS PREVIOUSLY POSTED AND TO BE HELD. Defendant to have no contact with any Best Buy Store.  Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Duany Acosta Mesa in court.  Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter.  Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.   Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.
